BriefDescription: All ISU rejects
TLBIE snoop
Demand Instruction fetch request
TM resume instruction completed
Cycles in which the SRQ has at least one (out of four) empty slice
IERAT reloaded (after a miss) for 4K pages
L3 initiated LCO received retry on port 2 (can try 4 times)
Dispatch held due to Issue q full. Includes issue queue and branch queue
The processor's data cache was reloaded from a location other than the local core's L3 due to a marked load

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB with Modified (M) data from another core's ECO L3 on the same chip due to a data side request. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included
A Conditional Branch that resolved to taken was mispredicted as not taken (due to the BHT Direction Prediction).

A demand load referenced a line in an active fuzzy prefetch stream. The stream could have been allocated through the hardware prefetch mechanism or through software.Fuzzy stream confirm (out of order effects, or pf cant keep up)
Read-write data cache collisions
Cycles thread running at priority level 0 or 1
Data ERAT Miss (Data TLB Access) page size 16G (hpt mode) or 1G (radix mode)
Cycles in which no new instructions can be dispatched to the ICT after a flush.  History buffer recovery
A radix translation attempt missed in the TLB and all levels of page walk cache.
D-cache invalidates sent over the reload bus to the core
The processor's Instruction cache was reloaded from the local chip's Memory due to an instruction fetch (not prefetch)
Slot 0 of LRQ valid
Number of TM transactions that passed
All internal store rejects cause the instruction to go back to the SRQ and go to sleep until woken up to try again after the condition has been met
Prefetch scope predictor selected GS or NNS, but was wrong because scope was LNS
L3 TM CAM is full when a L2 castout of TM_SC line occurs.  Line is pushed to memory
TEND latency per thread
Cycles No room in ibuff

New P9 instruction LDMX. The definition of this new PMU event is (from the ldmx RFC02491):  The thread has executed an ldmx instruction that accessed a doubleword that contains an effective address within an enabled section of the Load Monitored region.  This event, therefore, should not occur if the FSCR has disabled the load monitored facility (FSCR[52]) or disabled the EBB facility (FSCR[56]).
timebase event
The processor's data cache was reloaded from local core's L2 with load hit store conflict due to a demand load
Cycles when a tablewalk is pending on this thread on table 0
All ISU rejects
L3 PF from Off chip memory
LCO sent with data port 1
Load tm hit in L1
Ic line invalidated
Dispatch Hold: Due to TLBIE
Completion Stalled because the thread was blocked
TM snoop that is a store hits line in L3 in T, Tn or Te state (shared modified)
Data Tablewalk Cycles.  Could be 1 or 2 active tablewalks. Includes data prefetches.
Read-write data cache collisions
Duration in cycles to reload with Modified (M) data from another core's ECO L3 on the same chip due to a marked load

Prefetch stream allocated in the conservative phase by either the hardware prefetch mechanism or software prefetch. The sum of this pair subtracted from the total number of allocs will give the total allocs in normal phase
ls3 l1 tm cam cancel
Dispatch Flush: TLBIE
Duration in cycles to reload from another chip's memory on the same Node or Group (Distant) due to a marked load
Duration in cycles to reload from local core's L2 due to a marked load
Core TM load hits line in L3 in TM_SC state and causes it to be invalidated
A hwsync instruction was decoded and transferred
L3 PF sent with nodal scope port 1, counts even retried requests

Counts the number of cycles the LRQF is full.  LRQF is the queue that holds loads between finish and completion.  If it fills up, instructions stay in LRQ until completion, potentially backing up the LRQ
The processor's data cache was reloaded from local core's L2 with load hit store conflict due to a marked load
L3 CO received retry port 3 (memory only), every retry counted
Any port snooper hit L3.  Up to 4 can happen in a cycle but we only count 1
L3 CO to memory port 0 with or without data
Prefetch stream allocated by the hardware prefetch mechanism

Store instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the Store of that size.  If the Store wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty
A sync is in the S2Q (edge detect to count)
Marked instruction was reloaded from a location beyond the local chiplet
Counts the number of cycles in which the IFU was not able to decode and transmit one or more instructions because all itags were in use.  This means the ICT is full for this thread
I-cache Invalidates sent over the realod bus to the core
If a load that has already returned data and has to relaunch for any reason then gets a miss (erat, setp, data cache), it will often be flushed at relaunch time because the data might be inconsistent
L3 Hits for demand LDs
All ops that drain from s2q to L2 containing data
The processor's data cache was reloaded from another chip's memory on the same Node or Group ( Remote) due to a marked load
L2 guess local (LNS) and guess was correct (ie data local)
L3 Hits (L2 miss hitting L3, including data/instrn/xlate)
Load tm L1 miss
L3 initiated LCO received retry on port 1 (can try 4 times)
Rotating sample of 16 RD actives
Duration in cycles to reload from local core's L3 without dispatch conflicts hit on Mepf state due to a marked load
Software L1 Prefetches, including SW Transient Prefetches
Dispatch/CLB Hold: Balance Flush
Marked demand reload
Marked ld latency
Completion stall due to cache miss resolving missed the L3
Cycles in which this thread's run latch is set and the core is in SMT4 mode
Duration in cycles to reload either shared or modified data from another core's L2/L3 on a different chip (remote or distant) due to a marked load
All internal store rejects cause the instruction to go back to the SRQ and go to sleep until woken up to try again after the condition has been met

Load instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the load of that size.  If the load wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty
Cycles in which 10 or  more DARQ1 entries (out of 12) are in use
TM snoop that is a store hits line in L3 in M or Mu state (exclusive modified)
It is most often caused by certain types of flush where the pointer is not available. Can result in the data in the link stack becoming unusable.
RC requests that were local (aka chip) pump attempts
TM suspend instruction completed
A data line was written to the L1 due to a hardware or software prefetch
TM Load (fav or non-fav) ran into conflict (failed)
The processor's data cache was reloaded from local core's L3 with dispatch conflict due to a marked load
Run_Instructions
Marked L3 misses that can throw a synchronous interrupt
A TM-ineligible instruction tries to execute inside a transaction and the LSU disallows it
D-side L2 MRU touch commands sent to the L2
marked store finished with intervention
A load-hit-load condition with Strong Address Ordering will have address compare disabled and flush

XL-form branch was mispredicted due to the predicted target address missing from EAT.  The EAT forces a mispredict in this case since there is no predicated target to validate.  This is a rare case that may occur when the EAT is full and a branch is issued

Load instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the load of that size.  If the load wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty

Store instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the Store of that size.  If the Store wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty
L3 CO received retry port 2 (memory only), every retry counted
BTAC predicts a taken branch and the BHT agrees, and the target address is correct
The processor's data cache was reloaded from the local chip's L4 cache due to a demand load
TM Store (fav or non-fav) ran into conflict (failed)
All ops that drain from s2q to L2 and contain no data

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB with Shared (S) data from another core's L2 on the same chip due to a marked data side request. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included

Unconditional Branch Completed. HW branch prediction was not used for this branch. This can be an I-form branch, a B-form branch with BO-field set to branch always, or a B-form branch which was covenrted to a Resolve.

A demand load referenced a line in an active fuzzy prefetch stream. The stream could have been allocated through the hardware prefetch mechanism or through software.Fuzzy stream confirm (out of order effects, or pf cant keep up)
Prefetch stream allocated by software prefetching
Load tm L1 miss
LS1 finished load vector op
Completion time outer tend
LSU reports every cycle the thread is in HPT translation mode (as opposed to radix mode)
Number of load instructions that finished with an L1 miss. Note that even if a load spans multiple slices this event will increment only once per load op.
Marked derat reload (miss) for any page size
L3 PF missed in L3
The processor's data cache was reloaded with Shared (S) data from another chip's L2 or L3 on the same Node or Group (Remote), as this chip due to a demand load
L3 PF sent with grp scope port 1, counts even retried requests
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a store that was held in LSAQ because the SRQ was full
Conditional Branch Completed that had its target address predicted. Only XL-form branches set this event.  This equal the sum of CCACHE, LSTACK, and PCACHE
Conditional Branch Completed that was Mispredicted due to the Count Cache Target Prediction
RC retries on PB for any load from core (excludes DCBFs)
Primary ERAT hit.  There is no secondary ERAT
LS0 Erat miss due to prefetch
A demand load referenced a line in an active prefetch stream. The stream could have been allocated through the hardware prefetch mechanism or through software. Includes forwards and backwards streams
L2 guess local (LNS) and guess was not correct (ie data not on chip)
Data TLB Miss page size 64K
addrs only req to L2 only on the first one,Indication that Load footprint is not expanding
Data TLB Miss page size 4K
The processor's data cache was reloaded from local core's L3 with dispatch conflict due to a demand load
Dataless L3 LCO sent port 1
Duration in cycles to reload from local core's L2 with dispatch conflict due to a marked load
Number of times a load or store instruction was unable to launch/relaunch because a high priority prefetch used that relaunch cycle

Reloading line was brought in private for a specific thread.  Most lines are brought in shared for all eight threads.  If RA does not match then invalidates and then brings it shared to other thread. In P7 line brought in private , then line was invalidat
Non-TM Load caused any thread to fail

All D-side-Ld or I-side-instruction-fetch dispatch attempts for this thread that failed due to reasons other than an address collision conflicts with an L2 machines (e.g. Read-Claim/Snoop machine not available)
sampled Instruction suffered an icache Miss
Completion Tm nested tbegin
L3 CO to memory port 1 with or without data
False LHS match detected

PMC3 Rewind Value saved
LS1 Erat miss due to prefetch
Lifetime, sample of RD machine 0 valid
All successful D-side-Ld/St or I-side-instruction-fetch dispatches for this thread that were an L2 miss

Store instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the Store of that size.  If the Store wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty
Instruction Demand sectors written into IL1
Any port snooper detects a store to a line in the Sx state and invalidates the line.  Up to 4 can happen in a cycle but we only count 1

Load instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the load of that size.  If the load wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty

The LSU requested a line from L2 for translation.  It may be satisfied from any source beyond L2.  Includes speculative instructions. Includes instruction, prefetch and demand

Duration in cycles to reload with Shared (S) data from another core's L3 on the same chip due to a marked load

LSU workaround flush.  These flushes are setup with programmable scan only latches to perform various actions when the flush macro receives a trigger from the dbg macros. These actions include things like flushing the next op encountered for a particular thread or flushing the next op that is NTC op that is encountered on a particular slice. The kind of flush that the workaround is setup to perform is highly variable.
Any store finished by an LSU slice
Cycles thread running at priority level 6 or 7
L2 I cache demand request due to branch Mispredict ( 15 cycle path)
Read blocked due to interleave conflict.  The ifar logic will detect an interleave conflict and kill the data that was read that cycle.
L3 PF sent with sys scope port 0, counts even retried requests
IERAT Reloaded (Miss) for a 64k page

Counts the number of cycles the LRQF is full.  LRQF is the queue that holds loads between finish and completion.  If it fills up, instructions stay in LRQ until completion, potentially backing up the LRQ
Snoop dispatched for a read and was M (true M)
Marked store had to do a bkill
ls2 l1 tm cam cancel
Finish stall because the NTF instruction was a load that was held in LSAQ (load-store address queue) because the LRQ (load-reorder queue) was full
L3 CO of line in Mep state (includes casthrough to memory).  The Mepf state indicates that a line was brought in to satisfy an L3 prefetch request

mult marked instr

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB either shared or modified data from another core's L2/L3 on a different chip (remote or distant) due to a data side request. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included
Duration in cycles to reload from another chip's L4 on a different Node or Group (Distant) due to a marked load
Instruction fetches from L1.  L1 instruction hit

L3 CO to memory OR of port 0 and 1 (lossy = may undercount if two cresp come in the same cyc)
L2 Castouts - Modified (M,Mu,Me)
Number of times a load or store instruction was unable to launch/relaunch because a high priority prefetch used that relaunch cycle
A larx is flushed because an older larx has an LMQ reservation for the same thread.  A stcx is flushed because an older stcx is in the LMQ.  The flush happens when the older larx/stcx relaunches
Non-TM snoop hits line in L3 that is TM_SC state and causes it to be invalidated
RC retries on PB for any store from core (excludes DCBFs)
The processor's Instruction cache was reloaded from local core's L2 hit without dispatch conflicts on Mepf state. due to an instruction fetch (not prefetch)
Dispatch time Favored tbegin
Ict empty for this thread due to dispatch hold on this thread due to Issue q full, BRQ full, XVCF Full, Count cache, Link, Tar full
Branch mispredict flushes.  Includes target and address misprecition
A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB from the local chip's L4 cache due to a instruction side request
L3 Misses for demand LDs
L2 guess grp (GS or NNS) and guess was correct (data intra-group AND ^on-chip)

New P9 instruction LDMX. The definition of this new PMU event is (from the ldmx RFC02491):  The thread has executed an ldmx instruction that accessed a doubleword that contains an effective address within an enabled section of the Load Monitored region.  This event, therefore, should not occur if the FSCR has disabled the load monitored facility (FSCR[52]) or disabled the EBB facility (FSCR[56]).
A TM-ineligible instruction tries to execute inside a transaction and the LSU disallows it
Continuous 16 cycle (2to1) window where this signals rotates thru sampling each RC machine busy. PMU uses this wave to then do 16 cyc count to sample total number of machs running

A Page Table Entry was reloaded to a level 4 page walk cache from beyond the core's L3 data cache. This is the deepest level of PWC possible for a translation. The source could be local/remote/distant memory or another core's cache
All I-side-instruction-fetch dispatch attempts for this thread that failed due to an address collision conflict with an L2 machine already working on this line (e.g. ld-hit-stq or RC/CO/SN machines)
The TAGE overrode BHT direction prediction and it was correct.  Counted at completion for taken branches only
Dispatch/CLB Hold: Scoreboard
Non transactional conflict from LSU, gets reported to TEXASR
The processor's data cache was reloaded from a memory location including L4 from local remote or distant due to a marked load
L2 CO miss
CO mach 0 Busy. Used by PMU to sample ave CO lifetime (mach0 used as sample point)
Duration in cycles to reload from local core's L3 with dispatch conflict due to a marked load
Duration in cycles to reload from local core's L3 due to a marked load
Duration in cycles to reload with Modified (M) data from another core's L3 on the same chip due to a marked load
The processor's Instruction cache was reloaded either shared or modified data from another core's L2/L3 on a different chip (remote or distant) due to an instruction fetch (not prefetch)

TM aborted because a self-induced conflict occurred in Suspended state, due to one of the following: a store to a storage location that was previously accessed transactionally; a dcbf, dcbi, or icbi specify- ing a block that was previously accessed transactionally; a dcbst specifying a block that was previously written transactionally; or a tlbie that specifies a translation that was pre- viously used transactionally
Scalar flop operation completed
All successful D-side load dispatches that were an L2 miss (NOT Sx,Tx,Mx) for this thread and the RC calculated the request should be for 128B (i.e., M=0)
Number of stcx instructions finished. This includes instructions in the speculative path of a branch that may be flushed
An lwsync instruction was decoded and transferred
Completion time outer tbegin
L3 initiated LCO received retry on port 0 (can try 4 times)

Valid when first beat of data comes in for an D-side fetch where data came EXCLUSIVELY from memory that was for hpc_read64, (RC had to fetch other 64B of a line from MC) i.e., number of times RC had to go to memory to get 'missing' 64B
TM aborted because the tracking limit for transactional storage accesses was exceeded.. Asynchronous
Ict empty for this thread due to dispatch holds because the History Buffer was full. Could be GPR/VSR/VMR/FPR/CR/XVF; CR; XVF (XER/VSCR/FPSCR)

Load instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the load of that size.  If the load wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty

Valid when first beat of data comes in for an D-side fetch where data came EXCLUSIVELY from memory (excluding hpcread64 accesses), i.e., total memory accesses by RCs
marked branches which are not strongly biased

The definition of this new PMU event is (from the ldmx RFC02491):  The thread has executed an ldmx instruction that accessed a doubleword that contains an effective address within an enabled section of the Load Monitored region. L2 did a cleanifdirty CO to the L3 (ie created an SC line in the L3) OR L2 TM_store hit dirty HPC line and L3 indicated SC line formed in L3 on RDR bus
Cycles in which the NTC sync instruction (isync, lwsync or hwsync) is not allowed to complete
ls0 l1 tm cam cancel
Load was not issued to LSU as a cache inhibited (non-cacheable) load but it was later determined to be cache inhibited
TM aborted because a conflict occurred with another transaction.
Store-Hit-Load Table Read Hit with entry Enabled
All successful D-side store dispatches for this thread that were L2 hits
Lifetime, sample of snooper machine 0 valid
Cycles in which all 4 Binary Floating Point units are busy. The BFU is running at capacity
Conditional branch completed that used pattern cache prediction
All successful D-Side Store dispatches that were an L2 miss for this thread
Prefetch stream allocated in the Ultra conservative phase by either the hardware prefetch mechanism or software prefetch
A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB with Shared (S) data from another chip's L2 or L3 on a different Node or Group (Distant), as this chip due to a instruction side request
L3 PF hit in L3 (abandoned)
Lifetime, sample of PF machine 0 valid
Correctable ECC error on reload data, reported at critical data forward time
Marked instruction experienced I cache miss
Dispatch Flush: Scoreboard
The processor's data cache was reloaded from a location other than the local core's L2 due to a marked load
TM Store (fav or non-fav) caused another thread to fail
Prefetch scope predictor selected VGS or RNS, but was wrong
The TAGE overrode BHT direction prediction and it was correct.   Includes taken and not taken and is counted at execution time
Primary ERAT hit.  There is no secondary ERAT
Completion time tabortnoncd, tabortcd, treclaim
L3 CO to L3.1 OR of port 0 and 1 (lossy = may undercount if two cresps come in the same cyc)
Cycles thread running at priority level 4 or 5
VSU instruction finished. Up to 4 per cycle
Conditional Branch Completed that used the Count Cache for Target Prediction

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB from another chip's L4 on the same Node or Group ( Remote) due to a data side request. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included
Duration in cycles to reload with Modified (M) data from another chip's L2 or L3 on a different Node or Group (Distant), as this chip due to a marked load
The instruction was flushed because of a sequential load/store consistency.  If a load or store hits on an older load that has either been snooped (for loads) or has stale data (for stores).
LSU flushes.  Includes all lsu flushes
The processor's data cache was reloaded with Shared (S) data from another chip's L2 or L3 on a different Node or Group (Distant), as this chip due to a marked load
False LHS match detected
Cycles thread running at priority level 2 or 3
Prefetch scope predictor selected GS or NNS, but was wrong because scope was VGS or RNS
Cycles when a tablewalk is pending on this thread on table 1
cycles L2 RC took for a bkill
Duration in cycles to reload from local core's L3 without conflict due to a marked load

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB from another chip's L4 on the same Node or Group ( Remote) due to a marked data side request. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included
L2 guess grp (GS or NNS) and guess was not correct (ie data on-chip OR beyond-group)
An ERAT miss was detected after a set-p hit. Erat tracker indicates fail due to tlbmiss and the instruction gets flushed because the instruction was working on the wrong address
Prefetch scope predictor selected VGS or RNS and was correct
Duration in cycles to reload from a memory location including L4 from local remote or distant due to a marked load
Load tm hit in L1
RC requests that were on group (aka nodel) pump attempts
Data TLB Miss page size 16M (HPT) or 2M (Radix)
All successful D-side Load dispatches for this thread (L2 miss + L2 hits)
Math flop instruction completed
LS0 finished load vector op
L3 PF sent with sys scope port 1, counts even retried requests

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB with Shared (S) data from another core's L3 on the same chip due to a marked data side request.. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included
Cycles in which all the threads have the run latch set

Other LSU flushes including: Sync (sync ack from L2 caused search of LRQ for oldest snooped load, This will either signal a Precise Flush of the oldest snooped loa or a Flush Next PPC); Data Valid Flush Next (several cases of this, one example is store and reload are lined up such that a store-hit-reload scenario exists and the CDF has already launched and has gotten bad/stale data); Bad Data Valid Flush Next (might be a few cases of this, one example is a larxa (D$ hit) return data and dval but can't allocate to LMQ (LMQ full or other reason). Already gave dval but can't watch it for snoop_hit_larx. Need to take the “bad dval” back and flush all younger ops)
threaded version, IC Misses where we got EA dir hit but no sector valids were on. ICBI took line out

Quad-word loads (lq) are considered atomic because they always span at least 2 slices.  If a snoop or store from another thread changes the data the load is accessing between the 2 or 3 pieces of the lq instruction, the lq will be flushed

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB from a location other than the local core's L2 due to a data side request. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included
Any Branch instruction completed
L3 PF sent with grp scope port 0, counts even retried requests
VSU marked instr finish
The processor's data cache was reloaded either shared or modified data from another core's L2/L3 on a different chip (remote or distant) due to a marked load

A Page Table Entry was loaded into the TLB either shared or modified data from another core's L2/L3 on the same chip due to a data side request. When using Radix Page Translation, this count excludes PDE reloads. Only PTE reloads are included
SNP dispatched for a write and was M (true M); for DMA cacheinj this will pulse if rty/push is required (won't pulse if cacheinj is accepted)
Conditional Branch Completed in which the HW correctly predicted the direction as taken.  Counted at completion time

Store instructions whose data crosses a double-word boundary, which causes it to require an additional slice than than what normally would be required of the Store of that size.  If the Store wraps from slice 3 to slice 0, thee is an additional 3-cycle penalty
Decimal Unit marked Instruction Finish
L3 castout of line that was StoreCopy (original value of speculatively written line) in a Transaction

Effective Address alias flush : no EA match but Real Address match.  If the data has not yet been returned for this load, the instruction will just be rejected, but if it has returned data, it will be flushed
All D-side-Ld or I-side-instruction-fetch dispatch attempts for this thread
cycles to drain st from core to L2
L3 Misses (L2 miss also missing L3, including data/instrn/xlate)
The LSU detects the condition that a stcx instruction failed. No requirement to wait for a response from the nest
Completion stall due to cache miss that resolves in local memory
Nested or not nested tend failed for a marked tend instruction
All L1 D cache load references counted at finish, gated by reject
False LHS match detected
Any port snooper L3 miss or collision.  Up to 4 can happen in a cycle but we only count 1
L2 guess system (VGS or RNS) and guess was not correct (ie data ^beyond-group)
CyclesMSR[EE] is off and external interrupts are active
A TM-ineligible instruction tries to execute inside a transaction and the LSU disallows it
TM Load (fav) caused another thread to fail
SN mach 0 Busy. Used by PMU to sample ave SN lifetime (mach0 used as sample point)
L3 CO received retry port 0 (memory only), every retry counted
Lifetime, sample of Write Inject machine 0 valid
L3 Lateral Castins Miss
Prefetch Canceled due to page boundary
L3 CO to L3.1 (LCO) port 0 with or without data
Dispatch flush
L3 PF received retry port 1, every retry counted
All successful D-side store dispatches for this thread
All successful I-side-instruction-fetch (e.g. i-demand, i-prefetch) dispatches for this thread that were an L2 miss
LS0 Erat miss due to prefetch
Conditional Branch Executed in which the HW predicted the Direction or Target.  Includes taken and not taken and is counted at execution time
The processor's data cache was reloaded with Modified (M) data from another core's L3 on the same chip due to a marked load
Total L3 COs occurred on LCO L3.1 (good cresp, may end up in mem on a retry)
Prefetch Canceled due to icache hit
RD machine hit L3 PF machine
All successful D-side store dispatches for this thread (L2 miss + L2 hits)
L2 I cache demand request due to BHT redirect, branch redirect ( 2 bubbles 3 cycles)
Slot 0 of SRQ valid
Dataless L3 LCO sent port 0
CLB (control logic block - indicates quadword fetch block) Hold: Any Reason
All internal store rejects cause the instruction to go back to the SRQ and go to sleep until woken up to try again after the condition has been met
# PPC Dispatched
Number of outer tbegin instructions dispatched. The dispatch unit determines whether the tbegin instruction is outer or nested. This is a speculative count, which includes flushed instructions
Completion stall due to execution units (FXU/VSU/CRU)
LSU flush next reported at flush time.  Sometimes these also come with an exception
All ISU rejects
LS3 finished load vector op
L3 castout occurring (does not include casthrough or log writes (cinj/dmaw))
L3 castin of cache inject
Asserts when a i=1 store op is sent to the nest. No record of issue pipe (LS0/LS1) is maintained so this is for both pipes. Probably don't need separate LS0 and LS1
Counts the number of cycles the LMQ is full
Prefetch scope predictor selected GS or NNS and was correct
Fetching is stopped due to an incoming instruction that will result in a flush
All D-side store dispatch attempts for this thread that failed due to address collision with RC/CO/SN/SQ
Rotating sample of 32 PF actives
